item.title: some poems
item.description: Making it a commitment for 2022 to read some poems. The Jackdaw source William Cowper There is a bird who, by his coat And by the hoarseness of his note, Might be supposed a crow; A great frequenter of the church, Where, bishop-like, he finds a perch, And dormitory too. Above the steeple shines a plate, That turns and turns, to indicate From what point blows the weather. Look up – your brains begin to swim,
